name: V4.0.0
body:
## What's Changed
* Drop python support for 2.7, 3.4 and 3.5 by @jogo in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/321
* Use default for get ignore_exc by @jogo in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/351
* Return default from hash client by @Pankrat in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/352
* Return default from hash client when using positional argument by @Pankrat in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/354
* Support noreply for hash flush_all by @jogo in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/361
* Drop support for Python 3.6 by @jparise in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/363
* Add official support for Python 3.10 by @jparise in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/365
* Handle a blank stat value by @liquidpele in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/388
* Small buffer pass optimization as discussed in #395. by @martinnj in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/402
* Expand Client with a method for sending arbitrary commands.  by @martinnj in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/395
* add pluggable compression serde by @sontek in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/407
* Start to add type hints by @jogo in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/415
* Add py.typed file by @jogo in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/421
* Fix key_prefix issue with stats and cache_memlimit by @jogo in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/433

## New Contributors
* @JWCook made their first contribution in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/345
* @juandoleal made their first contribution in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/347
* @timgates42 made their first contribution in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/348
* @Pankrat made their first contribution in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/352
* @jugmac00 made their first contribution in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/355
* @dependabot made their first contribution in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/371
* @liquidpele made their first contribution in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/388
* @10kartik made their first contribution in https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/414

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/compare/v3.5.0...v4.0.0

name: v3.5.2
body: * Handle blank ``STAT`` values. (#388)

name: v3.5.1
body:
* ``Client.get`` returns the default when using ``ignore_exc`` and if memcached is unavailable.
* Added ``noreply`` support to ``HashClient.flush_all``.

name: v3.5.0
body:
* Sockets are now closed on ``MemcacheUnexpectedCloseError``.
* Added support for TCP keepalive for client sockets on Linux platforms.
* Added retrying mechanisms by wrapping clients.

name: v3.4.4
body: * Idle connections will be removed from the pool after ``pool_idle_timeout``. (#309)

name: v3.4.3
body: * Fix `HashClient.{get,set}_many()` with UNIX sockets. (#314)

name: v3.4.2
body: * Remove trailing space for commands that don't take arguments, such as ``stats``. This was a violation of the memcached protocol. (#311)

name: v3.4.1
body: * CAS operations will now raise ``MemcacheIllegalInputError`` when ``None`` is given as the ``cas`` value.

name: v3.4.0
body:
* Added IPv6 support for TCP socket connections.
* `HashClient` now supports UNIX sockets.

name: v3.3.0
body:
* ``HashClient`` can now be imported from the top-level ``pymemcache`` package (e.g. ``pymemcache.HashClient``).
* ``HashClient.get_many()`` now longer stores ``False`` for missing keys from unavailable clients. Instead, the result won't contain the key at all.
* Added missing ``HashClient.close()`` and ``HashClient.quit()``.

name: v3.2.0
body: * ``PooledClient`` and ``HashClient`` now support custom ``Client`` classes

name: v3.1.1
body: * Improve ``MockMemcacheClient`` to behave even more like ``Client``

name: v3.1.0
body:
* Add TLS support for TCP sockets.
* Fix corner case when dead hashed server comes back alive.

name: v3.0.1
body:
* Make MockMemcacheClient more consistent with the real client.
* Pass ``encoding`` from HashClient to its pooled clients when ``use_pooling`` is enabled.

name: v3.0.0
body:
* The serialization API has been reworked. Instead of consuming a serializer and deserializer as separate arguments, client objects now expect an argument ``serde`` to be an object which implements ``serialize`` and ``deserialize`` as methods. (``serialize`` and ``deserialize`` are still supported but considered deprecated.)
* Validate integer inputs for ``expire``, ``delay``, ``incr``, ``decr``, and ``memlimit`` -- non-integer values now raise ``MemcacheIllegalInputError``
* Validate inputs for ``cas`` -- values which are not integers or strings of 0-9 now raise ``MemcacheIllegalInputError``
* Add ``prepend`` and ``append`` support to ``MockMemcacheClient``.
* Add the ``touch`` method to ``HashClient``.
* Added official support for Python 3.8.

name: v2.2.2
body: * Fix `long_description` string in Python packaging.

name: v2.2.1
body: * Fix ``flags`` when setting multiple differently-typed values at once.

name: v2.2.0
body:
* Drop official support for Python 3.4.
* Use ``setup.cfg`` metadata instead ``setup.py`` config to generate package.
* Add ``default_noreply`` parameter to ``HashClient``.
* Add ``encoding`` parameter to ``Client`` constructors (defaults to ``ascii``).
* Add ``flags`` parameter to write operation methods.
* Handle unicode key values in ``MockMemcacheClient`` correctly.
* Improve ASCII encoding failure exception.

name: v2.1.1
body: * Fix `setup.py` dependency on [six](https://pythonhosted.org/six/) already being installed.

name: v2.1.0
body:
* Public classes and exceptions can now be imported from the top-level `pymemcache` package (e.g. `pymemcache.Client`). #197 
* Add UNIX domain socket support and document server connection options. #206 
* Add support for the `cache_memlimit` command. #211
* Commands key are now always sent in their original order. #209

name: v2.0.0
body:
* Change set_many and set_multi api return value. #179
* Fix support for newbytes from python-future. #187
* Add support for Python 3.7, and drop support for Python 3.3
* Properly batch Client.set_many() call. #182
* Improve _check_key() and _store_cmd() performance.  #183
* Properly batch Client.delete_many() call. #184
* Add option to explicitly set pickle version used by serde. #190

name: v1.4.4
body:
New in version 1.4.4
--------------------

* pypy3 to travis test matrix
* full benchmarks in test
* fix flake8 issues
* Have mockmemcacheclient support non-ascii strings

name: v1.4.3
body:
New in version 1.4.3
--------------------
* Documentation improvements
* Fixed cachedump stats command, see [ticket](https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/issues/103)
* Honor default_value in HashClient

name: Drop Python 2.6 support
body: Drop python 2.6 support

- Python 3 serializations [fixes](https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/pull/131)
- Drop support for pypy3
- Comment cleanup
- Add gets_many to hash_client
- Better checking for illegal chars in key

name: v1.4.0: Unicode Key Support
body:
## New in version 1.4.0
- Unicode keys support. It is now possible to pass the flag `allow_unicode_keys` when creating the clients
- Fixed a bug where PooledClient wasn't following `default_noreply` arg set on init, thanks @kols!
- Improved documentation

name: v1.3.8
body:
## New in version 1.3.8
- use cpickle instead of pickle when possible (python2)

name: v1.3.7
body:
## New in version 1.3.7
- default parameter on get(key, default=0)
- fixed docs to autogenerate themselves with sphinx
- fix linter to work with python3
- improve error message on illegal Input for the key
- refactor stat parsing
- fix MockMemcacheClient
- fix unicode char in middle of key bug
